cont.entity_a: Excellent with clear audio and no background noise. Impressive surround sound effect. Excellent Dolby Digital and Prologic sound. Lacks bass depth, particularly noticeable in DTS movies.
cont.entity_b: Crisp and clean with no noise cancelling white noise. Bright sound. Not comparable to higher-end brands like Bose.

cont.entity_a: Fit with well-fitting muffs and headband. Comfortable for short periods, but ear cushions can cause soreness over time.
cont.entity_b: Sometimes forgettable due to comfort. Ear holes are small, making them uncomfortable for some users. Hard clamp on the head can cause discomfort.

cont.entity_a: Durability is a concern as the plastic parts can snap easily. Plastic build quality is not very strong, leading to structural issues. Headphones are not very durable; prone to breaking.
Expensive, but worth the price if bought on sale below $150.
cont.entity_b: Price is reasonable for the sound quality offered.

cont.entity_a: Requires line of sight to the transmitter to work properly. Limited by line-of-sight requirement; obstacles can disrupt sound. Good for short-range use and requires staying still for best experience.
cont.entity_b: Cord is short, limiting movement at a desk. Portable.

cont.entity_a: Infrared technology prevents radio interference but limits mobility.
Rechargeable batteries included but need to be replaced as they don't hold charge after some time. Replacement batteries are expensive and often out of stock.
Easy to set up and use.
Volume is adjustable and strong with no static.

cont.entity_b: Good for blocking out ambient noise at home or office.
